C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group 135 S2 Workers in the Value Chain Targets, actions, channels to raise concerns and processes to remediate negative impacts on value chain workers Actions taken and processes implemented by Allianz to assess and address (potential) human rights impacts on value chain workers depend on the stage of the value chain, while they are all guided by the UNGPs. For commercial insurance and non- listed proprietary investments, risk assessments and mitigating actions are governed by the ASIS , while those for our listed proprietary investments are governed by the FRSI , as described above. For the supply chain, risk assessments and mitigating actions are governed by the Allianz Group Standard for Procurement . We track the effectiveness of our actions and processes through the Corporate Rules Book process as described in the section s section Sustainability integration .   • C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group 146 G1 Business Conduct external channel. Group Compliance runs an annual global awareness campaign to remind employees of the avenues available for reporting. Under the headline SpeakUp@Allianz , our worldwide complaints mechanism has the following features: − It is accessible to Allianz employees, to the employees of Allianz ’s direct and indirect suppliers, and to anyone else who might be impacted by the economic activities of Allianz . − It enables people to draw attention to human rights and environmental risks, as well as violations of human rights or environmental obligations, that have arisen as a result of the economic activities of Allianz or of direct or indirect suppliers. − The Allianz compliance experts responsible for handling the reports submitted through SpeakUp@ Allianz are independent and observe confidentiality rules. C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement Annual Report 2024 − Allianz Group 146 G1 Business Conduct external channel. Group Compliance runs an annual global awareness campaign to remind employees of the avenues available for reporting. Under the headline SpeakUp@Allianz , our worldwide complaints mechanism has the following features: − It is accessible to Allianz employees, to the employees of Allianz ’s direct and indirect suppliers, and to anyone else who might be impacted by the economic activities of Allianz . − It enables people to draw attention to human rights and environmental risks, as well as violations of human rights or environmental obligations, that have arisen as a result of the economic activities of Allianz or of direct or indirect suppliers. − The Allianz compliance experts responsible for handling the reports submitted through SpeakUp@ Allianz are independent and observe confidentiality rules.
  • the reporting person. The Allianz Group has specific procedures in place to ensure that no retaliation measures such as (written) warnings, demotion, dismissal, exclusion from promotions/bonuses, or other disadvantageous measures are taken against whistleblowers, reflecting our commitment to en able a healthy SpeakUp culture within the company. Retaliation measures in any form are not accepted. Reported cases of potential misconduct are treated in strict confidentiality. In the anti- retaliation procedure, the Compliance and HR fu nctions exchange information to the extent necessary to allow identifying any potential measures that could compromise the integrity or objectivity of the investigation procedure and jeopardize whistleblower safeguarding rules. All reported incidents are assessed, documented, and managed following the internal guidelines stipulated in the Allianz Group Compliance Policy , the Allianz Standard for Anti -financial Crime the reporting person. Retaliation measures in any form are not accepted. Reported cases of potential misconduct are treated in strict confidentiality. In the anti- retaliation procedure, the Compliance and HR fu nctions exchange information to the extent necessary to allow identifying any potential measures that could compromise the integrity or objectivity of the investigation procedure and jeopardize whistleblower safeguarding rules. All reported incidents are assessed, documented, and managed following the internal guidelines stipulated in the Allianz Group Compliance Policy , the Allianz Standard for Anti -financial Crime

  • be part of the fossi l fuel value chain. Beyond that, the end -use of fossil fuels is not in scope of this criterion (e.g., combustion engine vehicles or oil-fired heating systems). Thus, the DNSH criterion is automatically fulfilled for retail business, as private use is consi dered as end -use. In our portfolio screening approach, we applied the International Standard of Industrial Classification of economic activities (ISIC codes) to identify insurance policies which are not in line with the DNSH criterion as defined above: The different ISIC co des have been classified as either compliant with DNSH, not compliant with DNSH, or to be assessed on an individual customer level. We have screened our portfolios against this internal classification system. As our commercial risks are allocated to ISIC codes (or comparable national or internal classifications), we could identify insurance policies and revenues which do not comply with DNSH. be part of the fossi l fuel value chain. Beyond that, the end -use of fossil fuels is not in scope of this criterion (e.g., combustion engine vehicles or oil-fired heating systems). Thus, the DNSH criterion is automatically fulfilled for retail business, as private use is consi dered as end -use. In our portfolio screening approach, we applied the International Standard of Industrial Classification of economic activities (ISIC codes) to identify insurance policies which are not in line with the DNSH criterion as defined above: The different ISIC co des have been classified as either compliant with DNSH, not compliant with DNSH, or to be assessed on an individual customer level. We have screened our portfolios against this internal classification system. As our commercial risks are allocated to ISIC codes (or comparable national or internal classifications), we could identify insurance policies and revenues which do not comply with DNSH.
  • purposes. However, we continue to monitor the evolution of the Taxonomy Regulation to cover further sectors of the economy and become a tool for portfolio steering in th e future. In addition, as part of the 2024 Taxonomy reporting, Allianz is required to disclose its exposure to the six nuclear and gas activities stipulated in the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2022/ 1214 ( Annex III). This disclosure seeks to elicit the portion of aligned investments that are a result of the stated activities. For 2024, Allianz ’s exposure to nuclear and gas activities is considered very small (around 3 % of aligned assets for turnover and CAPEX based on total alignment figures). The eligible tu rnover based exposure of all other objectives beside climate change is around 2 % in 2024. Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management purposes. However, we continue to monitor the evolution of the Taxonomy Regulation to cover further sectors of the economy and become a tool for portfolio steering in th e future. In addition, as part of the 2024 Taxonomy reporting, Allianz is required to disclose its exposure to the six nuclear and gas activities stipulated in the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2022/ 1214 ( Annex III). This disclosure seeks to elicit the portion of aligned investments that are a result of the stated activities. For 2024, Allianz ’s exposure to nuclear and gas activities is considered very small (around 3 % of aligned assets for turnover and CAPEX based on total alignment figures). The eligible tu rnover based exposure of all other objectives beside climate change is around 2 % in 2024. Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management
S1-21

L'entreprise publie-t-elle des informations sur l'alignement de ses politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre avec les instruments internationaux pertinents, y compris les principes directeurs des Nations Unies relatifs aux entreprises et aux droits de l'homme ?

nan

Oui, l'entreprise publie des informations sur l'alignement de ses politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre avec les instruments internationaux pertinents, y compris les principes directeurs des Nations Unies relatifs aux entreprises et aux droits de l'homme. Le contexte mentionne que Allianz suit les lignes directrices de l'Organisation de coopération et de développement économiques (OCDE) pour les entreprises multinationales et les Principes directeurs des Nations Unies relatifs aux entreprises et aux droits de l'homme (UNGP). Ces engagements sont intégrés dans leurs politiques de droits humains, de diligence raisonnable et de stratégie d'entreprise, comme souligné dans les sections S1 et S2 du rapport.


Afficher les sourcesLLM
Sources LLM :
  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation et les points de données associés, classés par leur matérialité ("matériel", "non matériel" ou "non pertinent") et leurs sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections. Les exigences matérielles incluent : 1. **ESRS S2-1** : Non-respect des principes des UNGPs et des lignes directrices de l'OCDE (paragraphe 19) et politiques de diligence raisonnable liées aux conventions fondamentales de l'OIT (1 à 8, paragraphe 19), dans les sous-sections "politiques Allianz ESRS" et "stratégie et modèle d'affaires liés aux travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur". 2. **ESRS S2-4** : Questions et incidents relatifs aux droits humains dans la chaîne de valeur (paragraphe 36), avec des cibles, actions et processus pour remédier aux impacts négatifs. 3. **ESRS S3-1** : Engagements politiques en matière de droits humains (paragraphe 16) et non-respect des principes des UNGPs, de l'OIT ou de l'OCDE (paragraphe 17), dans le cadre de la stratégie et du modèle d'affaires liés aux communautés affectées. 4. **ESRS S3-4** : Questions et incidents relatifs aux droits humains (paragraphe 36), avec des actions et processus d'engagement avec les communautés affectées. 5. **ESRS S4-4** : Questions et incidents relatifs aux droits humains (paragraphe 35), avec des actions. 6. **ESRS G1-4** : Incidents confirmés de corruption ou de pots-de-vin (paragraphes 24 (a) et (b)). Les points non matériels ou non pertinents incluent : - **ESRS S4-1** : Politiques liées aux consommateurs et utilisateurs finaux (paragraphes 16 et 17), jugées non applicables. - **ESRS G1-1** : Convention des Nations Unies contre la corruption (paragraphe 10 (b)) et protection des lanceurs d'alerte (paragraphe 10 (d)), avec des politiques déjà en place. and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation liées à divers aspects des droits humains, de la corruption et des politiques de diligence raisonnable. Il indique si ces exigences sont considérées comme "matérielles", "non matérielles" ou "non pertinentes", et précise les sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections associées. Les points matériels incluent des politiques et des actions liées aux droits humains, aux travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur, aux communautés affectées, ainsi qu'aux incidents confirmés de corruption ou de pots-de-vin. Les points non matériels ou non pertinents concernent principalement les politiques déjà en place ou les aspects jugés non applicables.

  • Le tableau présente une liste de sujets de durabilité, des exigences de divulgation associées, des sections correspondantes et des sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections détaillant les aspects spécifiques à traiter. Les sujets incluent "E4 Biodiversity and ecosystems", "E5 Resource use and circular economy" et "S1 Own workforce". Pour "E4 Biodiversity and ecosystems", les sous-sections couvrent la stratégie et le modèle d'affaires, la matérialité, les politiques, les actions et les objectifs liés à la biodiversité et aux écosystèmes. Pour "E5 Resource use and circular economy", les sous-sections incluent la matérialité, les politiques, les actions, les objectifs et les métriques, telles que l'influx de ressources et les déchets électroniques. Concernant "S1 Own workforce", les sous-sections abordent la stratégie "Group People and Culture", la matérialité, les politiques, l'engagement, les processus pour soulever des préoccupations, les actions, les objectifs, les caractéristiques des employés, la négociation collective, le genre, les générations, les salaires adéquats, la protection sociale, les personnes handicapées, l'apprentissage et le développement, la santé et la sécurité, l'équilibre travail-vie personnelle, l'écart de rémunération entre les sexes et les droits humains. Chaque sujet est structuré pour analyser les impacts, les risques et les opportunités liés à ces domaines. and

  • Le tableau présente des données sur les droits humains et la main-d'œuvre propre pour les années 2024 et 2023. Les colonnes incluent "Description", "Unité", "2024" et "2023". Les lignes sont : "Nombre de plaintes déposées par les employés via le mécanisme officiel de plaintes Allianz", "Nombre de plaintes déposées auprès des Points de Contact Nationaux pour les Entreprises Multinationales de l'OCDE", "Nombre d'incidents de discrimination, y compris le harcèlement", "Nombre d'incidents graves relatifs aux droits humains concernant la main-d'œuvre propre", et "Montant des amendes matérielles, pénalités et compensations pour incidents liés à la main-d'œuvre propre". En 2024, 388 plaintes ont été déposées via le mécanisme officiel de plaintes Allianz, et 31 incidents de discrimination, y compris le harcèlement, ont été signalés. Aucun incident grave relatif aux droits humains ou montant d'amendes n'a été enregistré pour cette année. Les données pour 2023 ne sont pas disponibles (n.a.). and

En 2024, 388 plaintes ont été déposées via le mécanisme officiel de plaintes Allianz, et 31 incidents de discrimination, y compris le harcèlement, ont été signalés. Aucun incident grave relatif aux droits humains ou montant d'amendes n'a été enregistré pour cette année. Les données pour 2023 ne sont pas disponibles (n.a.).

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation liées à différents aspects de la durabilité, classées par matière de durabilité, section et sous-section. Les principales catégories incluent les travailleurs dans la chaîne de valeur, les communautés affectées, les consommateurs et utilisateurs finaux, la stratégie et gouvernance de durabilité, la matérialité, et la conduite des affaires. Chaque catégorie est associée à des sous-sections spécifiques, telles que les politiques, les objectifs, les actions, les processus pour soulever des préoccupations, et les modèles stratégiques. Les informations couvrent des sujets variés, allant de la gestion des relations avec les fournisseurs à la prévention de la corruption et des activités de lobbying.

  • Allianz aims to identify, prevent, mitigate or remediate adverse human rights impacts linked to its business activities and operations, including our supply chain. Our approach is guided by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the U.N. Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights (UNGP). Our due diligence in own operations and supply chains complies with the German Supply Chain Due Diligence Act (GSCA) and is covered by the Allianz SE Human Rights Policy Statement. Please refer to the sections S1 Own workforce and S2 Workers in the value chain for further details. Our due diligence process for proprietary investments and commercial insurance can be found in the sections S2 Workers in the value chain and S3 Affected communities of this report. Allianz aims to identify, prevent, mitigate or remediate adverse human rights impacts linked to its business activities and operations, including our supply chain. Our approach is guided by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the U.N. Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights (UNGP). Our due diligence in own operations and supply chains complies with the German Supply Chain Due Diligence Act (GSCA) and is covered by the Allianz SE Human Rights Policy Statement. Please refer to the sections S1 Own workforce and S2 Workers in the value chain for further details. Our due diligence process for proprietary investments and commercial insurance can be found in the sections S2 Workers in the value chain and S3 Affected communities of this report.
  • C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement — — the International Bill of Human Rights, comprising the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and its two Optional Protocols, in addition to the core International Labor Organization (ILO) Conventions, comprising the prohibition of child labor and forced labor, freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining, occupational health and safety, and the elimination of discrimination in respect of employment and occupation. C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement — — the International Bill of Human Rights, comprising the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and its two Optional Protocols, in addition to the core International Labor Organization (ILO) Conventions, comprising the prohibition of child labor and forced labor, freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining, occupational health and safety, and the elimination of discrimination in respect of employment and occupation.
  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau détaille les "exigences de divulgation et points de données associés", leur "matérialité" (matériel ou non matériel), et les "sous-sections/sous-sous-sections" correspondantes. Les points matériels incluent : 1. **ESRS E4-2** : Politiques sur les océans/mer et la déforestation, liées à la biodiversité et aux écosystèmes. 2. **ESRS E5-5** : Déchets non recyclés et dangereux, liés à l'économie circulaire et à l'utilisation des ressources. 3. **ESRS S1-1** : Engagements en matière de droits humains, politiques de diligence raisonnable, prévention des accidents, et mécanismes de gestion des plaintes, liés à la main-d'œuvre propre. 4. **ESRS S1-14** : Santé et sécurité, incluant les accidents et jours perdus. 5. **ESRS S1-16** : Écarts de rémunération entre genres et ratios de rémunération. 6. **ESRS S1-17** : Incidents de discrimination et non-respect des principes directeurs de l'ONU et des lignes directrices de l'OCDE, liés aux droits humains dans la main-d'œuvre propre. 7. **ESRS 2-SBM-3 - S2** : Risques significatifs de travail des enfants ou forcé dans la chaîne de valeur. 8. **ESRS S2-1** : Engagements en matière de droits humains pour les travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur. Les points non matériels incluent les risques d'incidents de travail forcé ou des enfants (ESRS 2-SBM-3 - S1) et les mesures contre la traite humaine (ESRS S1-1). and

Les points de données matériels concernent principalement les politiques liées à la biodiversité, l'économie circulaire, la sécurité au travail, les droits humains, les mécanismes de gestion des plaintes, et les écarts de rémunération. Les points non matériels sont considérés comme non applicables.

  • Résumé du tableau : Le tableau présente les politiques d'Allianz en lien avec les normes ESRS, à savoir l'Allianz Standard for Integration of Sustainability (ASIS), l'Allianz Group Risk Policy (GRP) et l'Allianz Standard for P&C Underwriting (ASU). Ces politiques font partie du livre des règles d'entreprise d'Allianz et couvrent les dimensions de la chaîne de valeur telles que l'assurance, les investissements propriétaires, la gestion d'actifs et les opérations internes. Les politiques abordent des enjeux de durabilité identifiés comme matériels, notamment : E1 Changement climatique (atténuation et adaptation), E2 Pollution, E3 Ressources en eau et marines, E4 Biodiversité et écosystèmes, E5 Utilisation des ressources et économie circulaire, S1 Main-d'œuvre propre, S2 Travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur, S3 Communautés affectées, S4 Consommateurs et utilisateurs finaux, et G1 Conduite des affaires. Chaque politique est associée à des sections spécifiques dans la déclaration de durabilité d'Allianz, telles que : "Allianz Standard for Integration of Sustainability (ASIS)", "Climate Change Strategy and Net-Zero Transition", "Policies related to pollution", "Policies related to water and marine resources", "Policies related to biodiversity and ecosystems", "Policies related to resource use and circular economy", "Policies related to workers in the value chain", "Policies related to affected communities", "Allianz Group Risk Policy (GRP)", "Allianz Standard for P&C Underwriting (ASU)", "Policies related to climate change mitigation for our insurance portfolio", et "Policies related to climate change adaptation for our insurance portfolio". and

    Résumé du tableau : Le tableau présente trois politiques d'Allianz en lien avec les normes ESRS : ASIS, GRP et ASU. Ces politiques sont intégrées dans le livre des règles d'entreprise d'Allianz et couvrent différentes dimensions de la chaîne de valeur, notamment l'assurance, les investissements propriétaires, la gestion d'actifs et les opérations internes. Les politiques abordent divers enjeux de durabilité, tels que le changement climatique, la pollution, les ressources en eau et marines, la biodiversité, l'économie circulaire, les travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur, les communautés affectées, les consommateurs et la conduite des affaires. Chaque politique est également associée à des sections spécifiques dans la déclaration de durabilité d'Allianz.

  • ### Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les ratios et les montants monétaires relatifs aux actifs couverts par les indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) en pourcentage et en milliards d'euros (€ bn). Les informations incluent : - Les ratios pour le chiffre d'affaires ("Turnover", 2.1%) et les dépenses d'investissement ("CAPEX", 2.3%). - La valeur monétaire des actifs couverts par le KPI ("Monetary value of assets covered by the KPI", 71.5 € bn). - La valeur des dérivés ("Value in monetary amounts of derivatives", 3.0 € bn). - Les expositions aux entreprises financières et non financières non soumises aux articles 19a et 29a de la Directive 2013/34/EU, avec 29.2 € bn pour les entreprises non financières et 16.7 € bn pour les entreprises financières. - Les expositions aux entreprises financières et non financières de pays hors UE non soumises aux articles 19a et 29a de la Directive 2013/34/EU, avec 22.8 € bn pour les entreprises non financières et 10.2 € bn pour les entreprises financières. - Les expositions aux entreprises financières et non financières soumises aux articles 19a et 29a de la Directive 2013/34/EU, avec 9.9 € bn pour les entreprises non financières et 28.5 € bn pour les entreprises financières. - Les expositions à d'autres contreparties et actifs ("Value of exposures to other counterparties and assets", 12.6 € bn). - Les investissements des entreprises d'assurance ou de réassurance autres que ceux liés aux contrats d'assurance vie où le risque est supporté par les assurés ("Value of insurance or reinsurance undertaking’s investments other than investments held in respect of life insurance contracts where the investment risk is borne by the policy holders", 81.4 € bn). - Les investissements finançant des activités économiques non éligibles à la taxonomie, avec des ratios de 31.1% pour le chiffre d'affaires et 30.5% pour les CAPEX. - Les investissements finançant des activités économiques éligibles à la taxonomie mais non alignées, avec des ratios de 17.8% pour le chiffre d'affaires et 18.3% pour les CAPEX. and

    BEGIN TABLE

    ```markdown

    For financial undertakings 16.7
    Value of exposures to financial and non-financial undertakings from non-EU countries not subject to Articles 19a and 29a of Directive 2013/34/EU:
    For non-financial undertakings 22.8
    For financial undertakings 10.2
    Value of exposures to financial and non-financial undertakings subject to Articles 19a and 29a of Directive 2013/34/EU:
    For non-financial undertakings 9.9
    For financial undertakings 28.5
    Value of exposures to other counterparties and assets 12.6
    Value of insurance or reinsurance undertaking’s investments other than investments held in respect of life insurance contracts where the investment risk is borne by the policy holders 81.4

    Turnover 31.1
    CAPEX 30.5
    Value of all the investments that are funding Taxonomy-eligible economic activities, but not Taxonomy-aligned relative to the value of total assets covered by the KPI:
    Turnover 17.8
    CAPEX 18.3

    ```

Oui, l'entreprise publie des informations sur l'alignement de ses politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre avec les instruments internationaux pertinents. Selon le contexte fourni, Allianz soutient et respecte les droits de l'homme internationaux tels que définis dans la Déclaration universelle des droits de l'homme et les conventions fondamentales de l'Organisation internationale du travail (OIT). Les processus de diligence raisonnable d'Allianz sont alignés sur les Principes directeurs des Nations Unies relatifs aux entreprises et aux droits de l'homme (UNGPs), et les politiques liées à la main-d'œuvre propre sont jugées matérielles, notamment en ce qui concerne les engagements politiques en matière de droits de l'homme et les politiques de diligence raisonnable sur les questions abordées par les conventions fondamentales de l'OIT.


Afficher les sources Pypdf
Sources Pypdf :
  • ### Integrating sustainability in own operations We consider human rights as a minimum standard for the treatment of our employees. We conduct annual and ad-hoc assessments of risks to employee rights per the GSCA. If we find risks, we take preventive measures. If we find violations, we remedy them promptly and effectively (see our Policy Statement on Human Rights). We have implemented measures to minimize risks to human rights and labor standards in our own operations. These include: - The protection of human rights is enshrined in our corporate rules, depending on local laws and requirements. - Anonymous feedback tools and surveys let employees evaluate issues like workload, wages, and diversity. - Extensive measures ensure physical safety and improve health and well-being. - Training in sustainability-related issues, including equal treatment and occupational health & safety, at Group and subsidiary levels.
  • Allianz aims to identify, prevent, mitigate or remediate adverse human rights impacts linked to its business activities and operations, including our supply chain. Our approach is guided by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the U.N. Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights (UNGP). Our due diligence in own operations and supply chains complies with the legal obligations of the German Supply Chain Due Diligence Act (GSCA) and is covered by the Allianz SE Human Rights Policy Statement. Please refer to the sections S1 Own workforce and S2 Workers in the value chain for further details. Our due diligence process for proprietary investments and commercial insurance can be found in the sections S2 Workers in the value chain and S3 Affected communities of this report.
  • ### Strategy and business model related to workers in the value chain Allianz is committed to supporting and respecting the protection of international human rights, as well as ensuring it is not complicit in the abuse of human rights, as outlined in the International Bill of Rights and the ILO Core Conventions. This commitment also applies to our value chain. Allianz's due diligence approach to identify, prevent, and mitigate adverse human rights impacts linked to business activities has been guided by the OECD Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the UNGPs. As a multinational insurance and asset management company, our value chain encompasses workers at: - Allianz suppliers, - companies insured by Allianz, - companies that Allianz invests in as part of its proprietary investments, and - our tied agents responsible for distributing our products.
  • # --- Page 79 --- ## C_ Group Management Report_ Sustainability Statement ### Human rights in own workforce Allianz recognizes the importance of human rights as both a value- based and a business issue. We see respect for human rights as a minimum standard for responsible business, both within and beyond our direct operations. For further information on our human rights commitment see our Human Rights Policy Statement.
  • Rule for Human Rights Due Diligence in Own Operations reflects our further obligations to manage risks to the human rights of our employees, including equal treatment, occupational health and safety, freedom of association, and living wages, as well as the prohibition of child and forced labor. Employees are treated equally, regardless of national or ethnic origin, social origin, health status, disability, sexual orientation, age, gender, religious beliefs, or any other protected characteristic. The Allianz Functional Rule for Human Rights Due Diligence in Own Operations applies to the entire Allianz Group except for certain subsidiaries, which are covered by separate standards aligned with the general principles. We support and respect international human rights as outlined in the International Bill of Human Rights and the core International Labor Organization Convention. Our due diligence processes in own operations comply with the requirements of the GSCA, aligned with the UNGPs.
  • # --- Page 83 --- ## C_ Group Management Report_ Sustainability Statement ### Targets, actions, channels to raise concerns and processes to remediate negative impacts on value chain workers Actions taken and processes implemented by Allianz to assess and address (potential) human rights impacts on value chain workers depend on the stage of the value chain, while they are all guided by the UNGPs.
  • ### Policies related to workers in the value chain At Allianz, we address the management of material impacts on value chain workers through targeted due diligence processes with our business partners. An integral part of our due diligence processes across the value chain is due diligence on forced labor and child labor. In the event of identifying risks and issues, we may initiate engagement or make the decision not to collaborate with these business partners. These processes and actions are governed by different policies, depending on the specific value chain component. For our human rights commitment across the value chain, please refer to our Human Rights Policy Statement.
  • # --- Page 5 --- ### C_ Group Management Report_ Sustainability Statement - the International Bill of Human Rights, comprising the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and its two Optional Protocols, in addition to - the core International Labor Organization (ILO) Conventions, comprising the prohibition of child labor and forced labor, freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining, occupational health and safety, and the elimination of discrimination in respect of employment and occupation.

La intensidad de GHG basada en el mercado ("GHG intensity (market-based)") fue de **272.2 t en CO2e/€ mn** en 2024 y **356.0 t en CO2e/€ mn** en 2023. 4. Las emisiones totales de GHG basadas en la ubicación ("Total GHG emissions (location-based)2") fueron de **49,067,050.4 t en CO2e** en 2024 y **57,688,706.5 t en CO2e** en 2023. 5.   • ### BEGIN TABLE La tabla presenta los KPI/targets para el año 2025, con un objetivo del 100 %. Los indicadores incluyen: 1. **Reducción de emisiones propias en inversiones**: Emisiones absolutas financiadas de GHG en millones de toneladas de CO2e provenientes de corporaciones listadas, con un objetivo de **12.3 mn t CO2e**. 2. **Digital Net Promoter Score (dNPS)**: Porcentaje de líderes de lealtad en segmentos de negocio, con un objetivo de **50 %**. 3. **Inclusive Meritocracy Index (IMIX)**: Desarrollo contra el nivel de ambición general, con un objetivo de **77 %**. 4. **Plan de transición hacia compromisos de cero emisiones netas**: Incluye reducción de emisiones en el sector de motor retail y reducción de intensidad de emisiones en el sector comercial de Property-Casualty. 5. **Soluciones sostenibles en Property-Casualty**. 6. **Desarrollo del Digital Net Promoter Score (dNPS)** contra el nivel de ambición general. 7. **Desarrollo del Inclusive Meritocracy Index (IMIX)** contra el nivel de ambición general. 8. **Cumplimiento estricto de requisitos regulatorios y de gobernanza corporativa**, con enfoque en un sistema de gestión de riesgos adecuado y cultura de riesgos. 9. **Contribución de liderazgo**, con enfoque en atributos de personas de Allianz: Excelencia en clientes y mercado, liderazgo colaborativo, emprendimiento y confianza; evaluación multi-rater. ### END TABLE

Los años no están especificados en el contenido. 1. **ESRS S2-1** aborda el incumplimiento de los principios de los UNGPs sobre Empresas y Derechos Humanos y las directrices de la OCDE (párrafo 19), así como las políticas de diligencia debida relacionadas con los convenios fundamentales de la OIT (párrafo 19). Se menciona la aplicación de la cláusula de salvaguarda según ESRS 2.5(e) en relación con §§ 289e y 315c HGB para la brecha salarial de género en S1-16, sin más detalles.

Oui, l'entreprise publie des informations sur l'alignement de ses politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre avec les instruments internationaux pertinents, y compris les Principes directeurs des Nations Unies relatifs aux entreprises et aux droits de l'homme. Allianz suit les lignes directrices de l'Organisation de coopération et de développement économiques (OCDE) pour les entreprises multinationales et les Principes directeurs des Nations Unies sur les entreprises et les droits de l'homme (UNGP). Ces engagements sont détaillés dans leurs déclarations et politiques, comme mentionné dans les Contextes Num-2, Num-3, et Num-5.

  • Human Rights Policy Statement . On the basis of our risk assessments, we have identified the following human rights as the most relevant for our own workforce in the context of our business model: equal treatment, adequate wages, freedom of association and collective bargaining, and occu pational health and safety. For details on our policies, actions, and targets on these specific rights, please refer to the relevant sections of S1 Own workforce and the Allianz company website . Our official global complaints mechanism SpeakUp@ Allianz gives our employees, and everyone else, the opportunity to raise concerns including risks to, and violations of, human rights. The complaints mechanism is widely promoted through the Allianz intranet and other channels, and it forms part of the global training on violation reporting under GCSA. For further information on the channel, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery . Human Rights Policy Statement . On the basis of our risk assessments, we have identified the following human rights as the most relevant for our own workforce in the context of our business model: equal treatment, adequate wages, freedom of association and collective bargaining, and occu pational health and safety. For details on our policies, actions, and targets on these specific rights, please refer to the relevant sections of S1 Own workforce and the Allianz company website . Our official global complaints mechanism SpeakUp@ Allianz gives our employees, and everyone else, the opportunity to raise concerns including risks to, and violations of, human rights. The complaints mechanism is widely promoted through the Allianz intranet and other channels, and it forms part of the global training on violation reporting under GCSA. For further information on the channel, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery .
  • public human rights commitment, see the Allianz Human Rights Policy Statement and the Sustainability Integration Framework . While Allianz has not adopted a dedicated process to engage with value chain workers, human rights issues can be addressed through existing engagement channels. Everyone inside and outside Allianz can report issues related to the human rights of workers in our value chain through our independent complaints mechanism, SpeakUp@ Allianz , which is further detailed in the section G1 Business conduct . In 2024, no severe human rights violations of value chain workers were reported through SpeakUp@Alllianz. Adverse media screenings of potentially high -risk suppliers did not produce any information on human rights violations in our supply chain in 2024. For our insurance and proprietary investment, the ASIS process is designed to prevent Allianz from insuring or investing in public human rights commitment, see the Allianz Human Rights Policy Statement and the Sustainability Integration Framework . For our insurance and proprietary investment, the ASIS process is designed to prevent Allianz from insuring or investing in
  • purposes. However, we continue to monitor the evolution of the Taxonomy Regulation to cover further sectors of the economy and become a tool for portfolio steering in th e future. In addition, as part of the 2024 Taxonomy reporting, Allianz is required to disclose its exposure to the six nuclear and gas activities stipulated in the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2022/ 1214 ( Annex III). This disclosure seeks to elicit the portion of aligned investments that are a result of the stated activities. For 2024, Allianz ’s exposure to nuclear and gas activities is considered very small (around 3 % of aligned assets for turnover and CAPEX based on total alignment figures). The eligible tu rnover based exposure of all other objectives beside climate change is around 2 % in 2024. Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management purposes. However, we continue to monitor the evolution of the Taxonomy Regulation to cover further sectors of the economy and become a tool for portfolio steering in th e future. In addition, as part of the 2024 Taxonomy reporting, Allianz is required to disclose its exposure to the six nuclear and gas activities stipulated in the Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2022/ 1214 ( Annex III). This disclosure seeks to elicit the portion of aligned investments that are a result of the stated activities. For 2024, Allianz ’s exposure to nuclear and gas activities is considered very small (around 3 % of aligned assets for turnover and CAPEX based on total alignment figures). The eligible tu rnover based exposure of all other objectives beside climate change is around 2 % in 2024. Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management
  • Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management from E.U. Taxonomy investment reporting, in line with current market practice and our interpretation of existing regulatory requirements for 2024 reporting. The main alignment KPIs for 2024 include alignment based on turnover and alignment based on CAPEX. For our financial investments, each KPI is determined using only reported data for the investee. If, for example, Allianz has an investment in a company with a turnover alignment of 10 % and the book value of the investment is 100, Allianz would report a turnover alignment balance of 10. If Allianz has covered assets of 200, then the final alignment share based on turnover would be 10/200, or 5 %. The total alignment based on turnover additionally includes alignment shares from Allianz ’s own investment real estate held for investment, retail mortgages and renewable investments. The total alignment KPI based on CAPEX is determined in the same way. Allianz took the decision to de -scope third- party asset management from E.U. Taxonomy investment reporting, in line with current market practice and our interpretation of existing regulatory requirements for 2024 reporting. The main alignment KPIs for 2024 include alignment based on turnover and alignment based on CAPEX. For our financial investments, each KPI is determined using only reported data for the investee. If, for example, Allianz has an investment in a company with a turnover alignment of 10 % and the book value of the investment is 100, Allianz would report a turnover alignment balance of 10. If Allianz has covered assets of 200, then the final alignment share based on turnover would be 10/200, or 5 %. The total alignment based on turnover additionally includes alignment shares from Allianz ’s own investment real estate held for investment, retail mortgages and renewable investments. The total alignment KPI based on CAPEX is determined in the same way.
  • be part of the fossi l fuel value chain. Beyond that, the end -use of fossil fuels is not in scope of this criterion (e.g., combustion engine vehicles or oil-fired heating systems). Thus, the DNSH criterion is automatically fulfilled for retail business, as private use is consi dered as end -use. In our portfolio screening approach, we applied the International Standard of Industrial Classification of economic activities (ISIC codes) to identify insurance policies which are not in line with the DNSH criterion as defined above: The different ISIC co des have been classified as either compliant with DNSH, not compliant with DNSH, or to be assessed on an individual customer level. We have screened our portfolios against this internal classification system. As our commercial risks are allocated to ISIC codes (or comparable national or internal classifications), we could identify insurance policies and revenues which do not comply with DNSH. be part of the fossi l fuel value chain. Beyond that, the end -use of fossil fuels is not in scope of this criterion (e.g., combustion engine vehicles or oil-fired heating systems). Thus, the DNSH criterion is automatically fulfilled for retail business, as private use is consi dered as end -use. We have screened our portfolios against this internal classification system. As our commercial risks are allocated to ISIC codes (or comparable national or internal classifications), we could identify insurance policies and revenues which do not comply with DNSH.

Y Y Y Y Y Y A.1.2 Of which stemming from reinsurance activities 59.7 0.1 - Y Y Y Y Y Y A.1.2.1 Of which reinsured
S1-22

Les politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre abordent-elles explicitement la traite des êtres humains, le travail forcé ou obligatoire, ainsi que le travail des enfants ?

nan

Les politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre abordent explicitement le travail forcé et le travail des enfants à travers des processus de diligence raisonnable. Cependant, la traite des êtres humains n'est pas considérée comme un point matériel et n'est donc pas explicitement abordée dans les politiques mentionnées. Les documents indiquent qu'il existe des politiques de diligence raisonnable pour le travail forcé et le travail des enfants, mais les mesures pour prévenir la traite des êtres humains ne sont pas considérées comme matérielles (Context Num-2, Context Num-9).


Afficher les sourcesLLM
Sources LLM :
  • C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement — — the International Bill of Human Rights, comprising the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and its two Optional Protocols, in addition to the core International Labor Organization (ILO) Conventions, comprising the prohibition of child labor and forced labor, freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining, occupational health and safety, and the elimination of discrimination in respect of employment and occupation. C _ Group Management Report _ Sustainability Statement — — the International Bill of Human Rights, comprising the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights, and the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights and its two Optional Protocols, in addition to the core International Labor Organization (ILO) Conventions, comprising the prohibition of child labor and forced labor, freedom of association and the right to collective bargaining, occupational health and safety, and the elimination of discrimination in respect of employment and occupation.
  • Policies related to workers in the value chain At Allianz, we address the management of material impacts on value chain workers through targeted due diligence processes with our business partners. An integral part of our due diligence processes across the value chain is due diligence on forced labor and child labor. In the event of identifying risks and issues, we may initiate engagement or make the decision not to collaborate with these business partners. These processes and actions are governed by different policies, depending on the specific value chain component. For our human rights commitment across the value chain, please refer to our Human Rights Policy Statement. 134 S2 Workers in the Value Chain Policies related to workers in the value chain At Allianz, we address the management of material impacts on value chain workers through targeted due diligence processes with our business partners. An integral part of our due diligence processes across the value chain is due diligence on forced labor and child labor. In the event of identifying risks and issues, we may initiate engagement or make the decision not to collaborate with these business partners. These processes and actions are governed by different policies, depending on the specific value chain component. For our human rights commitment across the value chain, please refer to our Human Rights Policy Statement. 134 S2 Workers in the Value Chain
  • the material sustainability matters under S2, namely, “Working conditions”, “Equal treatment and opportunities for all”, and “Other work-related rights”, ASIS explores “Working conditions” and “Other work-related rights” through screening and searching for negative information about adequate wages, freedom of association or collective bargaining, child labor, forced labor, and health and safety. the material sustainability matters under S2, namely, “Working conditions”, “Equal treatment and opportunities for all”, and “Other work-related rights”, ASIS explores “Working conditions” and “Other work-related rights” through screening and searching for negative information about adequate wages, freedom of association or collective bargaining, child labor, forced labor, and health and safety.
  • ### END TABLE The section describes how Allianz’s commitment to human rights applies to the human rights and labor standards of workers in our value chain. For us, value chain workers encompass those at our suppliers, at the companies we insure and invest in, and at Allianz tied agents. For each of these stages of our value chain we have dedicated policies and actions, which are described below. They all aim to identify, assess, and mitigate risks to human rights as well as to stop and remediate human rights violations. Our complaints mechanism, NGO dialogue, and other channels allow us to engage with affected value chain workers. ### END TABLE The section describes how Allianz’s commitment to human rights applies to the human rights and labor standards of workers in our value chain. For us, value chain workers encompass those at our suppliers, at the companies we insure and invest in, and at Allianz tied agents. For each of these stages of our value chain we have dedicated policies and actions, which are described below. They all aim to identify, assess, and mitigate risks to human rights as well as to stop and remediate human rights violations. Our complaints mechanism, NGO dialogue, and other channels allow us to engage with affected value chain workers.
  • Regarding the protection of the human rights of people working for our tied agents, Allianz does not have standardized Group-wide policies to manage agents and other distribution channels. Instead, we rely on local policies, which are tailored to the unique conditions and regulatory environments of each country or region. For instance, it is common practice that a local Code of Conduct, which encompasses key points of S2, is in place for agents. This code is typically required to be signed by agents during the onboarding process, thereby embedding essential compliance measures from the outset of their engagement with Allianz. This method demonstrates that our commitment to ethical practices and human rights considerations is upheld across our global operations. Regarding the protection of the human rights of people working for our tied agents, Allianz does not have standardized Group-wide policies to manage agents and other distribution channels. Instead, we rely on local policies, which are tailored to the unique conditions and regulatory environments of each country or region. For instance, it is common practice that a local Code of Conduct, which encompasses key points of S2, is in place for agents. This code is typically required to be signed by agents during the onboarding process, thereby embedding essential compliance measures from the outset of their engagement with Allianz. This method demonstrates that our commitment to ethical practices and human rights considerations is upheld across our global operations.
  • We apply the following definition for human rights issues under ESRS: − A complaint is any expression of dissatisfaction about a person or group. Customer complaints that are not related to potential misconduct are excluded. For further information, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery. − An incident is a predicated and confirmed event or occurrence that is contrary to the rules as set out in Allianz´s internal rules and/or legal regulations. − A severe human rights incident/violation is defined as follows: 131 S1 Own Workforce − Every case of child labor. − Every case of forced labor and modern slavery, including human trafficking. − Every case of severe (sexual) harassment or other severe human rights violations. We apply the following definition for human rights issues under ESRS: − A complaint is any expression of dissatisfaction about a person or group. Customer complaints that are not related to potential misconduct are excluded. For further information, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery. − An incident is a predicated and confirmed event or occurrence that is contrary to the rules as set out in Allianz´s internal rules and/or legal regulations. − A severe human rights incident/violation is defined as follows: 131 S1 Own Workforce − Every case of child labor. − Every case of forced labor and modern slavery, including human trafficking. − Every case of severe (sexual) harassment or other severe human rights violations.
  • 134 S2 Workers in the Value Chain Given the breadth and changing nature of our global underwriting and proprietary investment portfolios and our global supply chain, Allianz is not a priori able to identify particular vulnerable groups for targeted policies. Being aware that, in certain sectors and certain countries, there is generally a heightened risk of human rights violations, we apply particular due diligence there. The ASIS is relevant for employees at insured companies and employees at non-listed investees. 134 S2 Workers in the Value Chain Given the breadth and changing nature of our global underwriting and proprietary investment portfolios and our global supply chain, Allianz is not a priori able to identify particular vulnerable groups for targeted policies. Being aware that, in certain sectors and certain countries, there is generally a heightened risk of human rights violations, we apply particular due diligence there. The ASIS is relevant for employees at insured companies and employees at non-listed investees.
  • On the basis of our risk assessments, we have identified the following human rights as the most relevant for our own workforce in the context of our business model: equal treatment, adequate wages, freedom of association and collective bargaining, and occupational health and safety. For details on our policies, actions, and targets on these specific rights, please refer to the relevant sections of S1 Own workforce and the Allianz company website. Our official global complaints mechanism SpeakUp@Allianz gives our employees, and everyone else, the opportunity to raise concerns including risks to, and violations of, human rights. The complaints mechanism is widely promoted through the Allianz intranet and other channels, and it forms part of the global training on violation reporting under GCSA. For further information on the channel, please refer to the section Corruption and bribery. We apply the following definition for human rights issues under ESRS: On the basis of our risk assessments, we have identified the following human rights as the most relevant for our own workforce in the context of our business model: equal treatment, adequate wages, freedom of association and collective bargaining, and occupational health and safety.   • Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau détaille les "exigences de divulgation et points de données associés", leur "matérialité" (matériel ou non matériel), et les "sous-sections/sous-sous-sections" correspondantes. Les points matériels incluent : 1. **ESRS E4-2** : Politiques sur les océans/mer et la déforestation, liées à la biodiversité et aux écosystèmes. 2. **ESRS E5-5** : Déchets non recyclés et dangereux, liés à l'économie circulaire et à l'utilisation des ressources. 3. **ESRS S1-1** : Engagements en matière de droits humains, politiques de diligence raisonnable, prévention des accidents, et mécanismes de gestion des plaintes, liés à la main-d'œuvre propre. 4. **ESRS S1-14** : Santé et sécurité, incluant les accidents et jours perdus. 5. **ESRS S1-16** : Écarts de rémunération entre genres et ratios de rémunération. 6. **ESRS S1-17** : Incidents de discrimination et non-respect des principes directeurs de l'ONU et des lignes directrices de l'OCDE, liés aux droits humains dans la main-d'œuvre propre. 7. **ESRS 2-SBM-3 - S2** : Risques significatifs de travail des enfants ou forcé dans la chaîne de valeur. 8. **ESRS S2-1** : Engagements en matière de droits humains pour les travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur. Les points non matériels incluent les risques d'incidents de travail forcé ou des enfants (ESRS 2-SBM-3 - S1) et les mesures contre la traite humaine (ESRS S1-1). and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation et les points de données associés, leur matérialité (matériel ou non matériel), ainsi que les sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections correspondantes. Les points de données matériels concernent principalement les politiques liées à la biodiversité, l'économie circulaire, la sécurité au travail, les droits humains, les mécanismes de gestion des plaintes, et les écarts de rémunération. Les points non matériels sont considérés comme non applicables.

  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : - En 2024, 96.9 % des employés sont couverts par un système de gestion de la santé et de la sécurité, contre une donnée non disponible pour 2023. - Aucun décès d'employés lié à des blessures ou maladies professionnelles n'est enregistré en 2024, contre un décès en 2023. - Aucun décès d'autres travailleurs sur site lié à des blessures ou maladies professionnelles n'est enregistré en 2024, avec une donnée non disponible pour 2023. - Le nombre d'accidents de travail enregistrables chez les employés diminue, passant de 847 en 2023 à 728 en 2024. - Le taux d'accidents de travail enregistrables par million d'heures de travail diminue également, passant de 3.7 en 2023 à 3.3 en 2024. - Les cas de maladies professionnelles enregistrables chez les employés diminuent significativement, passant de 534 en 2023 à 274 en 2024. - Le nombre de jours perdus en raison de décès, d'accidents ou de maladies professionnelles augmente légèrement, passant de 20,292 en 2023 à 21,251 en 2024. and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : - En 2024, 96.9 % des employés sont couverts par un système de gestion de la santé et de la sécurité, contre une donnée non disponible pour 2023. - Aucun décès d'employés lié à des blessures ou maladies professionnelles n'est enregistré en 2024, contre un décès en 2023. - Aucun décès d'autres travailleurs sur site lié à des blessures ou maladies professionnelles n'est enregistré en 2024, avec une donnée non disponible pour 2023. - Le nombre d'accidents de travail enregistrables chez les employés diminue, passant de 847 en 2023 à 728 en 2024. - Le taux d'accidents de travail enregistrables par million d'heures de travail diminue également, passant de 3.7 en 2023 à 3.3 en 2024. - Les cas de maladies professionnelles enregistrables chez les employés diminuent significativement, passant de 534 en 2023 à 274 en 2024. - Le nombre de jours perdus en raison de décès, d'accidents ou de maladies professionnelles augmente légèrement, passant de 20,292 en 2023 à 21,251 en 2024.

  • Résumé du contenu du tableau : - Le tableau présente les exigences de divulgation et les points de données associés, leur matérialité, et les sous-sections ou sous-sous-sections correspondantes. - Les divulgations liées aux risques climatiques physiques (ESRS E1-9), notamment l'exposition du portefeuille de référence, la répartition des montants monétaires par risque physique, la localisation des actifs significatifs, la valeur comptable des biens immobiliers par classes d'efficacité énergétique, et les opportunités climatiques, ne sont pas pertinentes pour l'exercice fiscal 2024 en raison de leur inclusion progressive. - Les émissions de polluants (ESRS E2-4) et certaines données sur l'eau (ESRS E3-4), comme la consommation totale d'eau et le recyclage, ne sont pas considérées comme matérielles. - Les ressources en eau et marines (ESRS E3-1), ainsi que les océans et mers durables, sont jugés matériels, avec des politiques associées. - La biodiversité et les écosystèmes (ESRS 2-SBM-3) sont partiellement matériels, notamment pour le paragraphe 16 (c), avec des politiques spécifiques. - Les pratiques agricoles et terrestres durables (ESRS E4-2) sont également considérées comme matérielles, avec des politiques liées à la biodiversité et aux écosystèmes. and

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : - Plusieurs exigences de divulgation liées aux risques climatiques physiques (ESRS E1-9) ne sont pas pertinentes pour l'exercice fiscal 2024 en raison de leur inclusion progressive. - Les données sur les polluants (ESRS E2-4) et certaines informations sur l'eau (ESRS E3-4) ne sont pas considérées comme matérielles. - Les ressources en eau et marines (ESRS E3-1) ainsi que les océans et mers durables sont jugés matériels, avec des politiques associées. - La biodiversité et les écosystèmes (ESRS 2-SBM-3) ainsi que les pratiques agricoles durables (ESRS E4-2) sont également considérés comme matériels, avec des politiques spécifiques.

  • Le tableau présente les thèmes de durabilité, les exigences de divulgation, les sections et les sous-sections associées. Les thèmes principaux incluent le changement climatique (E1), la pollution (E2) et les ressources en eau et marines (E3). Chaque thème est subdivisé en plusieurs sous-sections qui couvrent des aspects tels que les stratégies, les politiques, les actions, les cibles et les métriques liées à la durabilité. Pour le thème E1 – Changement climatique, les sous-sections incluent des stratégies de transition vers le net zéro, des politiques et actions de décarbonisation, des cibles de réduction des émissions de GES, et des métriques climatiques pour le groupe Allianz. Le thème E2 – Pollution aborde les politiques, actions et cibles spécifiques à la pollution. Le thème E3 – Ressources en eau et marines traite des politiques, actions et cibles liées à ces ressources. De plus, les processus d'identification et d'évaluation des impacts matériels, des risques et des opportunités sont mentionnés dans les sous-sections de matérialité (E1 – IRO-1, E2 – IRO-1, E3 – IRO-1). Les informations sont organisées par exigences de divulgation et par sections pour chaque thème. and

    E3-1 E3 Water and marine resources Policies related to water and marine resources
    E3-2 E3 Water and marine resources Targets and actions related to water and marine resources
    E3-3 E3 Water and marine resources Targets and actions related to water and marine resources

    Résumé du contenu du tableau : Le tableau présente les thèmes de durabilité, les exigences de divulgation, les sections et les sous-sections associées. Il couvre principalement trois thèmes : le changement climatique (E1), la pollution (E2) et les ressources en eau et marines (E3). Chaque thème est divisé en sous-sections détaillant les stratégies, politiques, actions, cibles et métriques liées à la durabilité. Les informations incluent des processus d'identification des impacts matériels, des risques et des opportunités, ainsi que des objectifs et des actions spécifiques pour chaque domaine.

Les politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre abordent explicitement la traite des êtres humains, le travail forcé ou obligatoire, ainsi que le travail des enfants. Allianz, par exemple, mentionne l'inclusion de la diligence raisonnable sur le travail forcé et le travail des enfants dans ses processus de gestion des impacts matériels sur les travailleurs de la chaîne de valeur (Context Num-3). De plus, le contexte Num-2 souligne que les conditions de travail, le traitement égal et les opportunités pour tous, ainsi que d'autres droits liés au travail, incluent le travail des enfants et le travail forcé, y compris la traite des êtres humains.


Afficher les sources Pypdf
Sources Pypdf :
  • ### Policies related to workers in the value chain At Allianz, we address the management of material impacts on value chain workers through targeted due diligence processes with our business partners. An integral part of our due diligence processes across the value chain is due diligence on forced labor and child labor. In the event of identifying risks and issues, we may initiate engagement or make the decision not to collaborate with these business partners. These processes and actions are governed by different policies, depending on the specific value chain component. For our human rights commitment across the value chain, please refer to our Human Rights Policy Statement.
  • From the material sustainability matters under S2, namely, "Working conditions", "Equal treatment and opportunities for all", and "Other work-related rights", ASIS explores "Working conditions" and "Other work-related rights" through screening and searching for negative information about adequate wages, freedom of association or collective bargaining, child labor, forced labor, and health and safety. Regarding the protection of the human rights of people working for our tied agents, Allianz does not have standardized Group-wide policies to manage agents and other distribution channels. Instead, we rely on local policies, which are tailored to the unique conditions and regulatory environments of each country or region.
  • ### Strategy and business model related to workers in the value chain Allianz is committed to supporting and respecting the protection of international human rights, as well as ensuring it is not complicit in the abuse of human rights, as outlined in the International Bill of Rights and the ILO Core Conventions. This commitment also applies to our value chain. Allianz's due diligence approach to identify, prevent, and mitigate adverse human rights impacts linked to business activities has been guided by the OECD Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises and the UNGPs. As a multinational insurance and asset management company, our value chain encompasses workers at: - Allianz suppliers, - companies insured by Allianz, - companies that Allianz invests in as part of its proprietary investments, and - our tied agents responsible for distributing our products.
  • ### END TABLE Sub-section/sub-sub-section Strategy and business model related to workers in the value chain Materiality of Workers in the value chain, Strategy and business model related to workers in the value chain Policies related to workers in the value chain Targets, actions, channels to raise concerns and processes to remediate negative impacts on value chain workers Targets, actions, channels to raise concerns and processes to remediate negative impacts on value chain workers Targets, actions, channels to raise concerns and processes to remediate negative impacts on value chain workers Targets, actions, channels to raise concerns and processes to remediate negative impacts on value chain workers Strategy and business model related to affected communities Materiality of affected communities, Strategy and business model related to affected communities Policies related to affected communities
  • To mitigate potential human rights impacts, we employ the policies and procedures outlined in this section. This includes channels to raise concerns and due diligence for possible impacts on workers in our value chain. The identified impacts have the potential to translate into risks for Allianz. These risks encompass reputational, operational, consumer, and human behavior-related risk, as well as legal risks. Allianz recognizes these risks and has implemented various mitigation actions and initiatives to address them; see section Policies related to workers in the value chain.
  • ### Processes and channels to raise concerns For further information, please refer to the sections Human rights in own workforce and Corruption and bribery.
  • ### Taking action on material impacts, risks, and opportunities We implement specific actions, managed by dedicated Group People and Culture functions, to act on material impacts, mitigate material risks, and pursue material opportunities (see the section Group People and Culture strategy - Related impacts, risks, and opportunities). These actions are outlined in the remaining sections: - Characteristics of our employees, - Processes for engaging with our own workforce, - DEI (Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion), - Learning and development and performance management, - Fair remuneration, - Human rights in own workforce, - Social protection and health and safety. The structure of the sections in the remainder of "S1 Own workforce" generally adheres to the Policies - Actions - Targets logic.
  • ### Social protection and health and safety This section includes the disclosures relevant to the topics of "Work-life balance", "Social protection", and "Health and safety" as covered by the ESRS S1 Own Workforce sustainability matter "Overall working conditions".
  • ### BEGIN TABLE La tabla presenta actividades relacionadas con la energía nuclear y el gas fósil en el año 2023. **Etiquetas y columnas:** - **Columnas:** "0", "1", "2". - **Filas:** "Row", "Nuclear energy related activities", "Fossil gas related activities". **Actividades relacionadas con la energía nuclear:** 1. La empresa realiza, financia o tiene exposiciones en investigación, desarrollo, demostración y despliegue de instalaciones innovadoras de generación de electricidad que producen energía a partir de procesos nucleares con residuos mínimos del ciclo de combustible. **Estado:** NO. 2. La empresa realiza, financia o tiene exposiciones en la construcción y operación segura de nuevas instalaciones nucleares para producir electricidad o calor de proceso, incluyendo calefacción distrital, procesos industriales como la producción de hidrógeno, y mejoras de seguridad utilizando las mejores tecnologías disponibles. 3. La empresa realiza, financia o tiene exposiciones en la operación segura de instalaciones nucleares existentes que producen electricidad o calor de proceso, incluyendo calefacción distrital, procesos industriales como la producción de hidrógeno a partir de energía nuclear, y mejoras de seguridad. **Actividades relacionadas con el gas fósil:** 4. La empresa realiza, financia o tiene exposiciones en la construcción u operación de instalaciones de generación de electricidad que producen electricidad utilizando combustibles gaseosos fósiles. **Estado:** NO. 5. La empresa realiza, financia o tiene exposiciones en la construcción, renovación y operación de instalaciones de generación combinada de calor/frío y electricidad utilizando combustibles gaseosos fósiles. **Estado:** NO. 6. La empresa realiza, financia o tiene exposiciones en la construcción, renovación y operación de instalaciones de generación de calor/frío utilizando combustibles gaseosos fósiles. **Estado:** NO. ### END TABLE
  • ### Resumen de la tabla: La tabla presenta información sobre "Economic activities" y "CAPEX" en el contexto de actividades económicas elegibles según la taxonomía, pero no alineadas con ella, para el año 2024. Los datos están organizados en las siguientes columnas: "Row", "Economic activities", "Amount", "%", "Amount (Climate change mitigation - CCM)", "%", "Amount (Climate change adaptation - CCA)", "%". 1. Las filas 1 a 3 y 5 a 6, que corresponden a actividades específicas referidas en las Secciones 4.26, 4.27, 4.28, 4.30 y 4.31 de los Anexos I y II del Reglamento Delegado 2021/2139, no tienen valores reportados ("-"). 2. En la fila 4, correspondiente a la Sección 4.29, se reporta un "Amount" de 0.1 para "CAPEX" y "Climate change mitigation (CCM)", sin porcentaje asociado. 3. La fila 7, que incluye otras actividades elegibles no alineadas no mencionadas en las filas anteriores, reporta un "Amount" de 137.7 y un porcentaje de 18.3% tanto para "CAPEX" como para "Climate change mitigation (CCM)". 4. La fila 8, que resume el total de actividades elegibles pero no alineadas, reporta un "Amount" de 137.9 y un porcentaje de 18.3% para "CAPEX". No se reportan valores para "Climate change adaptation (CCA)" en ninguna fila.

Las columnas incluyen "Turnover" con "Amount and proportion" expresados en montos monetarios y porcentajes, desglosados en "Climate change mitigation (CCM)" y "Climate change adaptation (CCA)". Las filas enumeran actividades económicas específicas referidas en las Secciones 4.26 a 4.31 de los Anexos I y II del Reglamento Delegado 2021/2139, así como otras actividades no incluidas en dichas secciones. 1. Las filas 1, 2, 4, 5 y 6 no tienen datos reportados, mostrando "-" en todas las columnas. 2. En la fila 3, la actividad económica de la Sección 4.28 reporta un monto de 0.4 y un porcentaje de 0.1% tanto para CCM como para el total, sin datos para CCA. 3. La fila 7, que incluye otras actividades no referidas en las filas anteriores, reporta un monto de 15.5 y un porcentaje de 2.1% para CCM, 15.4 y 2.0% para el total, y 0.1 sin porcentaje para CCA. 4. La fila 8, que resume el "Total applicable KPI", muestra un monto de 16.0 y un porcentaje de 2.1% para CCM, 15.9 y 2.1% para el total, y 0.1 sin porcentaje para CCA.
  • ### BEGIN TABLE La tabla presenta los requisitos de divulgación y puntos de datos relacionados, clasificados por "Materiality" y "Sub-section/sub-sub-section". Los años no están especificados en el contenido. 1. **ESRS S2-1** aborda el incumplimiento de los principios de los UNGPs sobre Empresas y Derechos Humanos y las directrices de la OCDE (párrafo 19), así como las políticas de diligencia debida relacionadas con los convenios fundamentales de la OIT (párrafo 19). Ambos son materiales y se relacionan con las políticas de ESRS y el modelo de negocio estratégico para los trabajadores en la cadena de valor. 2. **ESRS S2-4** trata temas de derechos humanos e incidentes en la cadena de valor (párrafo 36), considerado material, con enfoque en objetivos, acciones, canales para plantear preocupaciones y procesos para remediar impactos negativos. 3. **ESRS S3-1** incluye compromisos de políticas de derechos humanos (párrafo 16) y el incumplimiento de principios de UNGPs, OIT u OCDE (párrafo 17), ambos materiales y vinculados al modelo de negocio estratégico para comunidades afectadas. 4. **ESRS S3-4** aborda temas e incidentes de derechos humanos (párrafo 36), considerado material, con enfoque en objetivos, acciones, canales para plantear preocupaciones y procesos de interacción con comunidades afectadas. 5. **ESRS S4-1** sobre políticas relacionadas con consumidores y usuarios finales (párrafo 16) y el incumplimiento de principios de UNGPs y OCDE (párrafo 17) no son materiales. 6. **ESRS S4-4** aborda temas e incidentes de derechos humanos (párrafo 35), considerado material, con enfoque en acciones. 7. **ESRS G1-1** sobre la Convención de las Naciones Unidas contra la Corrupción (párrafo 10 (b)) y la protección de denunciantes (párrafo 10 (d)) no son relevantes, ya que las políticas ya están implementadas. 8. **ESRS G1-4** sobre multas por violación de leyes anticorrupción y antirrobo (párrafo 24 (a)) y estándares anticorrupción y antirrobo (párrafo 24 (b)) son materiales, con enfoque en incidentes confirmados de corrupción o soborno. 9. Se menciona la aplicación de la cláusula de salvaguarda según ESRS 2.5(e) en relación con §§ 289e y 315c HGB para la brecha salarial de género en S1-16, sin más detalles.

Oui, les politiques en matière de main-d'œuvre abordent explicitement le travail forcé ou obligatoire ainsi que le travail des enfants. Allianz intègre la diligence raisonnable sur le travail forcé et le travail des enfants dans ses processus de diligence raisonnable à travers la chaîne de valeur. Cela fait partie de leur engagement en matière de droits de l'homme et est mentionné dans leur déclaration de politique sur les droits de l'homme (Context Num-1).

  • cover topics such as working conditions, equal treatment and opportunities for all, other work -related rights, and child labor and forced labor, including human trafficking. During the supplier onboarding process, suppliers registered in our standard tool for procurement are asked to comply with the VCoC or to submit a comparable code of conduct. For suppliers over a defined threshold, we apply additional checks, including questions on their human rights due diligence. This mitigates the risk of engaging with suppliers who do not uphold human rights standa rds. Additional actions and processes are based on voluntary commitments as well as the requirements of the GSCA . If risks related to violations of human rights of supply chain workers are identified, we take appropriate preventive measures, including, for example, engaging with the companies in question or adding human rights - related contractual clauses to the supplier agreement. In the event of identifying risks and issue s, we may initiate engagement or make the decision not to collaborate with these business partners.   • be part of the fossi l fuel value chain. Beyond that, the end -use of fossil fuels is not in scope of this criterion (e.g., combustion engine vehicles or oil-fired heating systems). Thus, the DNSH criterion is automatically fulfilled for retail business, as private use is consi dered as end -use. In our portfolio screening approach, we applied the International Standard of Industrial Classification of economic activities (ISIC codes) to identify insurance policies which are not in line with the DNSH criterion as defined above: The different ISIC co des have been classified as either compliant with DNSH, not compliant with DNSH, or to be assessed on an individual customer level. We have screened our portfolios against this internal classification system. As our commercial risks are allocated to ISIC codes (or comparable national or internal classifications), we could identify insurance policies and revenues which do not comply with DNSH. be part of the fossi l fuel value chain. Beyond that, the end -use of fossil fuels is not in scope of this criterion (e.g., combustion engine vehicles or oil-fired heating systems). Thus, the DNSH criterion is automatically fulfilled for retail business, as private use is consi dered as end -use. In our portfolio screening approach, we applied the International Standard of Industrial Classification of economic activities (ISIC codes) to identify insurance policies which are not in line with the DNSH criterion as defined above: The different ISIC co des have been classified as either compliant with DNSH, not compliant with DNSH, or to be assessed on an individual customer level. We have screened our portfolios against this internal classification system. As our commercial risks are allocated to ISIC codes (or comparable national or internal classifications), we could identify insurance policies and revenues which do not comply with DNSH.

  • NatCat scenarios and global hazard maps. However, effecti ve adaptation to climate change not only requires adequate pricing of risks, but also individual measures by customers. We have therefore started considering preventative actions taken by the customer in our products and pricing models. Living up to our ro le as a climate risk manager, we are also integrating advisory services into our customer communication and we provide relevant information to customers, for example, on how to build stronger resilience to climate- related events. In addition, we are committed to offering comprehensive insurance products for low -carbon technologies – such as battery electric vehicles (BEV) and the related ecosystem – as well as for renewable energy technologies, to support the transition of our cust omers toward more environment -friendly solutions. For instance, Allianz entities offer BEV insurance products, which meet the specific NatCat scenarios and global hazard maps.
